snippet: Transit officials said a family medical leave provision giving its 2,300 union workers up to six weeks of paid time off each year would be too expensive.
abstract: Transit officials at San Francisco's Bay Area Rapid Transit say family medical leave provision giving its 2,300 union workers up to six weeks of paid time off each year was erroneously included in labor contract that settled union dispute; officials call for return to bargaining table, saying provision is too expensive.
lead_paragraph: Transit officials said a family medical leave provision giving its 2,300 union workers up to six weeks of paid time off each year would be too expensive.

headline.main: Bay Area Transit Contract in Limbo Over a Provision
headline.print_headline: Bay Area Transit Contract In Limbo Over a Provision
